definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: You probably already know this, but I’m taking no chances.
sentences.chinese: 你或許已經明白了這些，但我要做到萬無一失。

sentences.english: Of course, you can always run your own backups to be sure.
sentences.chinese: 當然，您可以經常進行備份以確保萬無一失。

sentences.english: They'll always votes yes on an apple-pie-order-and-motherhood issue.
sentences.chinese: 他們對萬無一失的問題總是投贊成票的。

sentences.english: You are all the same jast like America.
sentences.chinese: 希望萬無一失，像在美國一樣。

sentences.english: Sichuan wild strong it is a spectacular game, be sure to ensure foolproof.
sentences.chinese: 川野堅強調這是一招險棋，一定要確保萬無一失。

sentences.english: Will using non-SureFire brand batteries void my SureFire warranty?
sentences.chinese: 將使用非神火品牌電池保修無效我的萬無一失？

sentences.english: But no raw cookie is necessarily safe.
sentences.chinese: 然而，生曲奇的安全性並非萬無一失。

sentences.english: But the process is not foolproof, because markets can also be wrong.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這種做法並非萬無一失，因爲市場也可能有錯。

sentences.english: The good Abbot of Holywood is a strong pillar to the weak.
sentences.chinese: “聖林”修道院的主持是弱者的萬無一失的靠山。

sentences.english: They'll always votes on an apple-pie-order-and-motherhood issue.
sentences.chinese: 他們對萬無一失的問題總是投贊成票的。

definition: night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
lit. four ounces can move a thousand catties (idiom)/fig. to achieve much with little effort
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
